one of the most malaria zones in the

difficult in its later stages malaria
manifested with extreme seizes locally
known as dengue dengue it killed both

acara Health Institute began in this

in fact the name if acara refers to a
place you go to die which is a
reflection of what life used to be here
in the days before organized public

primary role was to estimate how much

the villages and which mosquitoes were
transmitting the disease so my colleague
and myself comes 30 kilometres south of
Africa a town across the river every
evening we went into the villages with

trousers and waited for mosquitoes that
were coming to bite us so we could
collect them to check if they were
carrying malaria my colleague and myself
selected the household and we start
inside and outside swapping positions
every half hour and we did this for 12
hours every night for 24 consecutive
nights we slept for four hours every
morning
watch the rest of the day sorting
mosquitoes identifying them and chopping
off their heads so that they could be
analyzed in the lab to check if they
were carrying malaria parasites in their
blood thoughts this way we were able to
not only know how much malaria was going
on here but also which mosquitoes were
cutting this malaria we were also able
to know where the malaria was mostly
inside houses or outside houses today
ladies and gentlemen I still catch
mosquitos for a living
but I do this mostly to improve people's

what my colleagues and I have decided to

this is Dixon Louetta gerrae this is my

of course they're disease-free but what

that's Auto dissemination as we call it

the females fly into that dance and

kind of you know bomb spray them on

smell you and they have developed

if a car is to identify what it is in

and once we identify these substances we

according to the latest figures we have
from wahe of four hundred and twenty
nine thousand people most of these are

real life opportunities to have high

they carry most like 99% of all the

versity problem with it but that's
